Description: Fragment of flattened handle from a pottery transport amphora. Clay medium red-brown. Glazed? Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Greek inscription and grapes and double axe symbols.
Curator's comments: Name Pistos. Known from Salamis, Cyprus and Tarsus. Same die used for stamp in Benaki collection, Alexandria. Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 110, 44.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1354)
